title: Right-Pointing Magnifying Glass

verbs: To try to find, to look for, to search.
To try to locate an object (a file, a folder, a computer, a text).
To examine; to try; to put to the test.
Try to locate or discover, or try to establish the existence of
To try to see, to pay attention to with one's eyes.
Perceive with attention; direct one's gaze towards
Perceive by sight or have the power to perceive by sight
To perceive by the visual faculty.
To perceive or detect with the eyes, or as if by sight.
To see, or to look at.
nouns: The act of discovering something
The act by which something is uncovered.
Observing or finding something unknown
Discovery is the act of detecting something new, or something "old" that had been unknown.
The discovering of new things.
Act of finding.
The act of finding.
Act of detecting something new
The activity of looking thoroughly in order to find something or someone
An attempt to find something.
An amorphous solid material
Amorphous (non-crystalline) solid material
Amorphous (non-crystalline) substance.
A brittle transparent solid with irregular atomic structure

A hard, amorphous, inorganic, usually transparent, brittle substance made by fusing silicates, sometimes borates and phosphates, with certain basic oxides and then rapidly cooling to prevent crystallization.
Glass is any amorphous solid material that is capable of going from a hard to a more fluid state with increased temperature, without changing phase.
Light microscope consisting of a single convex lens that is used to produce an enlarged image
A magnifying glass is a convex lens that is used to produce a magnified image of an object.
Lens which makes things appear larger
A microscope with only one lens.
An optical device for magnification
An instrument made of convex glass, used to magnify.
An optical element which converges or diverges light
A transparent optical device used to converge or diverge transmitted light and to form images
A lens is an optical device which transmits and refracts light, converging or diverging the beam.
Optical device which transmits and refracts light
An object, usually made of glass, that focuses or defocuses the light that passes through it.
An optical device with perfect or approximate axial symmetry which transmits and refracts light, concentrating or diverging the beam.
Object focusing or defocusing the light passing through it.

description:
A classic magnifying glass, as used to view small objects, with its lens pointed right. Generally depicted at a 45° angle with a black handle and a clear or blue, silver-framed lens titled to the upper right.

Associated with detectives and search or zoom icons on computers. Like üîç Magnifying Glass Titled Left, commonly used for various senses of searching, looking, inspecting, etc.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's rendition of the tilted magnifying glass features a polished metallic frame with a clear, convex lens that catches the light, showcasing Apple's commitment to realistic rendering and glossy 3D shading. The handle is smoothly curved, and the overall design suggests meticulous examination or a keen search for detail. Used on Apple devices, this emoji signifies investigation, discovery, or the act of looking closely at something.
